go_data.justification: Galphaq is involved in signaling pathways mediated by G-protein coupled receptors.
Galphaq-deficient platelets do not aggregate and secrete their granule contents in response to various stimuli.
Gq-mediated activation of phospholipase C represents the central early signal transduction process leading to full platelet activation.
Galphaq is a key component in cell signaling pathways, particularly in platelet activation.
Platelet shape change is accompanied by actin polymerization and reorganization of the cytoskeleton.
